intro: Hieracium visianii, commonly known as the Visianii hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern. Hieracium visianii is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
